item.title: A Nikon surprise
item.description: Nikon announced the Nikon D5000. This camera has a few surprises (for me): The 'name' -- Looking at the name I would expect and entry level camera. One which is set below the Nikon D40 for example. Looking at...

item.title: Nikon at the Movies
item.description: The Nikon F as used at Dream Girls. The Nikon F started the F range that has 6 models up to today. This was Nikon's first professional camera, it had an impressive series of lenses from 21mm to 1000mm,...

item.title: The X Factor
item.description: The Nikon D3x is to be announced on Monday. According to the leaked Nikon specs in the NPS brochure, everything seems valid from the D3 firmware leak. It has 24.5 mpix, a D3 body, 5 pictures a sec frame rate...

item.title: Nikon D90 and D3x

item.title: Nikon D700 announced
item.description: Ok it's for real now, a D3 in a D300 body. A full frame sensor, the high ISOs and even a few extra features like a dust shaking sensor and a flash. A few things have been ripped of so...

item.description: After the previosu D700 images were identified as fake by engadget, we get another spyshot. D700, compared to the D3, with a slightly slower frame rate and 95% frame coverage....

item.title: Nikon D700, what's in a name

item.title: Nikon Coolpix P80
item.description: Nikon has announced a new camera, the Coolpix P80. As a former Coolpix 5700 user, this camera looks interesting. It has a whopping 18x zoomlens with VR and a 2.7" LCD on the back. What I like is the...

item.title: Nikon D60
